Say yer prayers, ya sulfur-smellin' sack o' shite.
Ya didn't see this one comin', did ya, ya hoity-toity trollop?
Guff here is makin' a play, so have at ya!
Oh, Exile, this one's bum's out the window. They're right crazy.
Piss off and boil yer head!
The Syndicate needs this done, and you're gonna foozle the whole affair!
Ah, well, ya know what they say: a numpty a day keeps victory away.
Ahem. Vagan.
Then you're about to sink... like an anchor, ya plenary whiffle-whaffle!
Wow! Bordering on potomania with that one. Or pyromania, I forget which. Off your hide, either way.
Oh and I'd find a way to drag you down with me, ya bloody scobberlotcher.
Agh, why are ya pickin' on Guff?
It's the one-two punch of doom!
Now, we'll get the job done for sure.
Aw, quicker now, the gaffer's here!
This one's knicked for sure now.
I command who? Ha-ku! That's you!
Oi Janus, guess what? I'm the baaawss!
Ha hah! A Brinerot captainin' a Redblade. Today's the day!
Don't shoot me, but I do enjoy lording over a Mutewind.
Riker, if you goof here, you are showing me what's under that mask.
It's Guff to friends, Captain to the rest!
Thank the gods... I mean, totally had that one under control the whole time.
Brinerot property remains Brinerot property!
Oof, not a pretty place to fall. I know I wouldn't want to rest here.
Never doubted... for a second... that I could do it!
Well this worked out rather nicely for Guff.
Captain Guff Gren escapes again!
Ahahahah! Yes!
Ohh, oh, me kidney...
My spleen, my poor spleen!
Acch, ya got me in the lung...
Ow! Ah ah ah ow! You hit me in the eyeball! Why the eyeball, Exile?
Not back to the bin? Ugh.
Guess I was better as a merchant than a fighter.
You gonna make me turn traitor again? 'Cause I - 'cause I will.
My head just keeps trying to leave me shoulders!
Well, look as us aye! Back and forth, forth and back.
I should never have jumped in like that. Aye... not great thinking.
Well, this is what I get for sticking me nose in!
Whoah ha hah ho, hohoho, oh! No, no. No, I am ready to do whatever you say.
Lemme recruit a numpty to this job. It's an old pirate trick. You attack when the worst man is on watch. Yeah. Yeah, makes it easy. So whaddya think?
Well, I can make friends, yeah, find things out. Everybody loves ol' Guff! You get information, I get to live. Yeah. So whaddya say?
Well I'm just no good at this job, so, how about you let me live, and I use me 'charm' to switch with someone else? Yeah. Yeah, that would let you reorganise things for your own ends...
That's it! I'm done! I'm out! Yep. I've had enough! This whole damn Syndicate's full of braindead... beetroots. Let me walk, Exile!
Now I'm no clipe, but sometimes, talking is better than, you know, dying. So just give lil' ol' Guff a chance to jabber and I guarantee you'll learn a thing or two.
I got treasure for ya, you know, if you look the other way, friend...
Good choice, Exile. Yep. You won't regret this.
I am on the job!
Next time you see me, I'll be a new man.
Goodbye forever, friend - well, least 'til next time!
There it is, eh? That's the sense I was hoping for. Now let's talk.
All that glitters is gold...
My gaffer's in a weak position, mutiny-wise. If you take mercy on me, I might just manage to, uh, depose 'em. Keen?
What if I told you I could spin a yarn and get all me mates demoted? That would be worth keeping me alive for that, right? Right?
Would ya care to kick one of me mates entirely out of the Syndicate? It's a big lie I can tell, but one I will get away with, mostly. You know, as long as you don't lop my head off!
They don't call me gobermouch for nothing. I've got gossip and the low-down on everyone here. Just ah... just give me a chance to jabber on.

Tora's so busy worrying about bloody trees and worms and... mice, she doesn't even see the rest of us bustin' our behinds to push the Syndicate forward. Let's give Tora somethin' to really worry about!
Jorgin is a murderer, or he hired one. He's way worse than me. If you are punishing me over him, then you're dumber than the barnacles on me backside.
Well! Can't never trust a Redblade, I always say. And I alway mean it, too.
Trustin' a Mutewind 'll get ya pincushioned by hidden blades, and I be speakin' from experience here.

I like Maloney, okay, don't get me wrong, but did ya ever have a mate who you could tell was just... after something? You know, makes me skin crawl, it does. Losing sleep over it! Really would rather not have to even think about it.
Haha awww, you know I didn't mean nothing by it! I'm not even the one you really want, right?
Just do it, ya git.
Watch carefully, gaffer. I give my life for the Syndicate.
I'm goin' out first, let me show you how it's done!
I would rather die than go another round with your torture chamber.
Ooh, that is not good for my prospects.
Do you want to kick my rear, Vagan, or bend it?
Believe me, Janus, no one's tryin' to do nothing to your booty.
Ya know what? I think he could make a fence post out of me, too.
Keep your sedition to yourself, you overgrown gobermouch!
Oh, you done foozled it now, Mutewind!
Why do I always get the short end of the stick?
I'm a talker, yes, but you will have to get me drunk first!
Stop locking me up!
Wait, wait, what happened to our dealing? We - we were gettin' on fine!
Ohh, not pretty. Ooh, that's not pretty at all.
Auggh, was me best mate!
Welp, no love lost there, let me tell ya.
Oh boy, hoo, Guff's done it now.
Brinerot! Dead ahead!
You Brinerots are as stupid as they say, aren't you?
Fun's over, Brinerot.
Keep your word, or lose your head.
Know where you're going? I believe you know it as the brig.
Brinerot, show the Syndicate you're still your own man!
Villainous scoundrel. Slink back to the seas, Brinerot.
Brinerot, you've been betrayed!
Since when does a Brinerot accept help?
You dare face us head on, Brinerot?
Witness the start of a new world order!
Meddler! Leave this place or perish.
You would assault our goods? Barbaric!
Did you wish to join the other corpses, Exile?
Don't make this harder than it has to be.
To think I just finished washing out the stench of prison.
Our dirty little deal is over, Exile.
Think I feel bad about what I did? Please.
I've long wanted to see how futile your cause truly is.
Back for more? How wonderful.
A Perandus is never alone.
Behold my machinery at maximum efficiency.
There is no avoiding your fate, Exile.
Relentless.
I only have to hit you with this once...
Trespassing is a crime, and criminals must be punished.
This property belongs to the Perandus, interloper! And the Syndicate.
How dare you attack my... our path to wealth.
What a dreadful mess.
This was meant to be done by now!
Gods, boredom will drive a man to do just about anything.
These grounds do not belong to you!
I've come to rescue you, savage. Thank me later.
Tora, your mark still walks. This is a problem!
You debauched overgrown toddler! Why does the Exile yet live?
I shouldn't have to do your job for you, assassin.
Here we are, Thane, fighting side by side, just as our ancestors did in the Labyrinth.
Typical. Just typical! Try not to cock this up.
Our territory needs better management.
This transport needs to be... redirected.
Such is my disdain for you, that I came down here.
Bad news, I'm afraid. The Exile's no longer the primary target.
I respect your conviction, Elreon, but our goals are at odds.
Sorry, Guff, but you're out. Too untrustworthy.
You're braindead, Hillock. It's time your body caught up.
Gravicius, let me remind you just what the Perandus name means.
Shame you can't go back to Ogham, Ezomyte. You don't belong here.
I'm quite sorry, but the political landscape has changed.
You moron. You should be defending me!
When the Lifegiver hears about this, you're done.
Fine. We'll handle your corpse, too.
This was supposed to be quick and easy.
I'm more than happy to defend my family's name. Try me.
What? We're on the same team!
Please don't splash whatever it is you're dripping with on me.
Then perhaps you should do something that will help me remember your name.
You I can handle myself.
You should know better than to stand in the way of a Perandus.
A Perandus never abandons good land.
We lose the carts, you lose your head.
Someone has some explaining to do.
How do you mess an ambush up this badly?
Do as I say, Karui, and we can keep the Eternal One out of this.
If my robes get ruined, Tora, you're squarely to blame.
The Brotherhood of Silence has always served my family well.
Simple Hillock, all you had to do was bash what I said.
Gravicius! You're the Sentari to my Chitus. You know what to do!
You know how this goes. Do what you're told and you'll be rewarded.
Well, it wasn't like you were ever going to win.
Nobody touches a Perandus' wealth.
Wonderful. Can we hurry this up?
I did it! All by myself...!
Remember this kindness, Exile.
My growing wealth remains secure.
Time's up, and you've got nothing to show for it.
No... I needed... this land...
My... cargo...
This... is not good...
Mortifying.
No more cells... you have to promise me...
You win... let's parlay.
To think... I worked with you...
Wait, let me think...!
I've never been so embarrassed.
What an absolute shambles.
You... went for the wrong person, Exile...
That was vivid. I see you're not one to bluff. Well, I'm not one to gamble. Okay, that - that's a lie, I love gambling, but not with my life. So, go on, what are you after?

A man of status has a way of bringing others up to his level, and what higher status is there than that of a Perandus? Yes, we're at odds, but consider, really consider, the benefits to you of not just having one but two men on the inside. One of them could even be a woman!

If you cut a Perandus, and you definitely should not do so, but if you do, we bleed diplomacy. Don't - don't test it. It's a metaphor. Put the knife away, and allow me to do what I was born to do: exchange information. If I whisper into the ear of a cohort, they will whisper into mine. And if you should overhear such whispers? Well, there's simply nothing I could do about that!

This work? This is grunt work. Look at me. Do I look like a grunt to you? Don't answer that. I didn't want to be doing this any more than you wanted me to. In fact, there's a job I've had my eye on for some time that I think you'll agree is much more suitable for a man of my stature.

The Syndicate is wonderful. It really is. If you weren't trying to kill all of us, I'd suggest you try it. Except I fear there's no more room... hmm... I know! I'll take a little leave of absence, and you can try it out for yourself! Might be tricky convincing the others, but, well, that won't really be my problem, will it?

My family name was once synonymous with intelligence, both of the mind, and of the... what's that ...thing called... espionage! Yes. Well, times may have changed, but we haven't. In exchange for keeping my lovely blood where it's meant to be, how about I tell you a few things you might find meaningful.

The Perandus family is not quite the goldmine it once was, but I myself am not entirely without items of value. Nothing is more valuable than the wonderful sound of my own beating heart, of course, so how about a good old fashioned pay-off?
Not the one I'd have chosen, but sure.
Thank you. Please put the knife down now.
Ah, nobleman's work. Lovely!
Just tell them I said it's fine for you to join. I'm quite popular. They may still try and attack you on sight, but can you really blame them?
Time to espionagerate. Espionify? Espi - time to talk!
Yes, yes... if anyone asks where you got such wondrous gifts, well, tell them it was me. Need to keep up appearances.

Oh Janus, you've really done it this time! Look at the situation you've got yourself in. You're an employee! Listen here, Exile. This whole organisation is flipped on its head. I should be running the thing! In fact... how about you let me go, and I put my silly little boss here in a more suitable role, and I take the plinth I was born to take.

Do you know how my family got to be so wealthy so long ago? Blackmail. Probably blackmail. It was... wait, was it? Actually, I'm not sure. I should check that, but I really think it was very likely blackmail. Anyway, I have a truly shocking amount of dirt on everyone here. Let me go, and I'll turn the Syndicate headquarters into a field... because of all the dirt.

If there's one thing I simply can't stand, it's dying. I'd do almost anything to avoid it. I'd go so far as to kill someone! Or get someone to kill someone on my behalf, anyway. Not overly fond of blood. Let me go, and I'll get the ol' ball rolling on that murder.

I love a bit of gossip, don't you? Who's rutting whom, who's been swiping gold from the coffers - me - who's been planning what where within the Syndicate... you know... gossip! Can't gossip if you're dead though. That is one of many things you cannot do when you're dead.
Haku is incorruptible, and that makes him extremely dangerous in a world of compromises and grey outcomes.
Leo's the kind of scrappy fighter who just won't give up. It's as impressive as it is dangerous. A clever individual like yourself would take any opportunity to force him to give in, I'm sure.

How often do you find yourself with an assassin from the Brotherhood of Silence at your whim? If you don't take advantage of such an opportunity, well, I simply can't be held responsible for whatever viciously sharp object ends up in your spine later.
Look, Guff's a nice guy, for a pirate. Have you ever met a nice pirate? A pirate who wasn't just waiting to 'plunder' the old 'booty' as they say? I certainly haven't.
General Gravicius still demands that we call him General. Anyone who cares that much about status makes my Perandus blood boil over. Please, show him just how much his rank is worth.
Yes, I'm a Perandus, but how much does that really mean anymore? Other Immortal Syndicate members are far more dangerous. I'm just charming.
I really do hate the idea of dying, but... oh, go on then. Get it over with.
A good nobleman will always die for their king or queen. Or boss.
I never thought I'd put my life before that of a friend, but here we are.
No. I will not go back to the cells. I refuse. You'll have to kill me. I'm serious.
Ha! Brilliant. Awful, really awful for me in particular, but brilliant.
Sometimes I wonder if my last name is a blessing or a curse.
Religion is for fools, holy man. At least power is real.
What? I'm innocent! Other than - oh.
I'd rather be a pathetic excuse for a man, Gravicius, than the monster you are.
Old grudges die hard, I guess. The brothers of Thanes, on the other hand...
You'll regret this. A Perandus always, always comes out on top.
Time to see how the paupers live I s'pose.
Absolutely not. No. No! Damn you, no!
What? Not even going to try to make another deal?
Gruesome.
That was really, really, really, really mean.
Yuck! Damn. I got some on me.
You... shouldn't even be here! This shouldn't be allowed!
At last, a chance to drive a sword through that Perandus skull.
In the dirt, worm.
Beg for your life, Perandus.
I'm going to kill you Janus... Just not yet.
Rot in that cage, bastard.
A vile devil of lies and greed betrays his own.
Janus... You-... You-...! You are going to pay for what you did to my- to OUR family.
Nothing you don't deserve, Janus.
Be careful how you help Janus... He may stab you in the back too.
Janus! I'm going to enjoy killing you.
Hey...! Why do you look so familiar...?
This is MY house. You're gonna DIE, little invaders.
My things, not yours! I'll SMASH YOU TO BITS!
You're not meant to see this! I'll KILL YOU TO DEATH!
Found you, little Exile. Now I'm gonna kill you!
Hate the dark. Hate YOU for putting me there!
YOU! Confuse me you did. Snap your little neck for that.
You made me hurt my friends. Now I'll hurt you!
You killed me. Now, I kill you. Make this one last.
I liked breaking you, little Exile. Glad I get to do it again.
Bash you harder than I've ever bashed before!
The people I kill are still with me.
One hit, Exile. All I need.
Run, toy! Run!
When I get mad, things burn. PEOPLE burn.
You walk into my home. MY home. I'll RIP your spine OUT!
I'll help kill the little invaders!
They're not your things little Exile!
Mash the little invaders into GOO!
Kill them dead! Hahahaha!
I'ma hurt you for fun.
I'll protect you! I'll protect the family! Rip little Exile heads off!
I'll help you smite.
Arrows? I hate arrows.
I'll help you stab.
I'll help you tear.
I'll help you, scary lady.
I'll help you bash.
You all hurt me. I'll hurt you all!
These are my things now, stupid.
Gonna kill all of you down here.
Ha! You stupid idiot, you fell into my trap.
I'm gonna get you, wild one!
You talk too much Vagan. I'm gonna shut that pretty little mouth.
Pretty Rin, I'm coming for ya!
Can I bash you, Cameria?
Scary little Aisling... you're mine now.
Bash Exile, bash Syndicate. Bash whoever.
You're in my house though, stupid.
I'll kill you too! I'll break all of you to CRUMBS!
Gonna keep your body. You're not gonna wake up again.
I'll paint with you later. A big red smear. Hahaha!
I'm gonna use your body to test my blades.
Hate pirates! Salty, smelly, rotten bunch.
Yeah? Well you're gonna be DEAD-dead!
Hey! Who are you calling dumb? Me? Hey!
I'll snap off every limb that touches me, bitch.
Then I'll bash you too.
Don't get in the way.
You protect the things! I'll bash the little Exile.
The bashing will be legendary!
Grind the Exile's bones into snuff.
Bash good, Leo, and I'll make you another hook.
Keep them arrows away from me. Point 'em at the Exile!
Little man with his blades, you stab what I say.
I am the strongest here, little Thane. I command.
My turn to choose what we rip apart!
You know what I want. Bash. Bash! BASH!
And stay out!
What's mine is mine.
Smushed.
Easy easy easy.
Huhuhahaha... HAHahahahahaha!
See? Nobody takes my things!
Bash you to bits later, little invaders.
Arrrgh!
Uggggggh!
My... toys...!
You cheated! Must have!
No... not in the dark again...
My head still hurts!
Don't make me... hurt my friends again...
No... don't want to die... again..
My turn... already...?
Bad... bad... BAD!
Stupid Hillock! Stupid!
You kill so good, Exile. Quick and splatty. You want to be friends just for today?
Want a friend, I do. Sit in my room, bashing my hammer, talking to myself... gettin' ANGRY... with a friend maybe I wouldn't hurt people no more. Will you help me find a friend?
Making a new friend, I am. We was gonna eat dinner together. Bit of the drink. Talk about work. Told me a few things already you know. Let me go and I'll tell you what they told me.
I tried and tried to do this job but I don't get it. It doesn't make SENSE to me! Hurts my head! Makes me ANGRY. Makes me BREAK STUFF! Don't make me stay here.
Miss the forge, I do. Can't make swords here the way I used to. Maybe you can tell the Lifegiver I burned to ashes and I can go back home. Back to the anvil, and the pub.

I hate this job. Hate it! Makes no sense to me! My boss gave me some scribbled paper. Told me everything I need to know is on it, but I can't make out the pictures. If you let me go, you can take a look. Maybe you can work out what it means.

Miss making my swords, I do. Sometimes, I get pictures in my head from a long time ago. Making beautiful swords. Better than I can make now. Feels like a different man in those pictures. A smarter man. Quicker. Been collecting a few pieces here and there. Not like the ones I make, but still strong. Makes me think of home, makes me feel connected to that smarter man. You can have them if you promise you won't hurt me anymore.
Maybe this will make the bad thoughts go...
Hard to make new friends, it is...
Oh no... this sounds hard, too!
I feel... happy...!
This make any sense to you?
Treat 'em good, okay?
Boss talks down to me. Like I'm stupid. I'm not stupid. I'm NOT! Makes me SO ANGRY. Angry enough to bash them over and over again! I should be the boss, not them!
The people in the Syndicate are afraid of me, they are. Know how good I can bash them. They'll give me whatever I want or else. Want to see?
I'm so angry right now Exile. Everything's RED. I need to hear bones SNAPPING. Need to feel it in my FISTS! I don't care who I break. Just tell me who. Tell me who!
I'll give the Syndicate here an option. I bash and bash and bash until I'm happy, or they tell you what you want to know. Then you let me go, okay?
Vagan's too wriggly. Tried to catch him but he slipped away. Don't let him slip away again. Might not get another chance!
I think I could smash Guff into the ground like a fence post. Bet he'd do anything to get out of that. What do you think, little Exile?
Found Korell in my room praying to my forge. In MY room. I didn't say he could do that! Makes me so ANGRY! Learn respect, Redblade! Teach him respect, Exile!
I want to break the mask off Maloney's face, just to see how his skull cracks. Bet there's a lot of good knowledge inside that skull.
You bash well, Exile! Today we are friends. Let's bash another one shall we? Yeah?
Hate myself. Hate the Syndicate. Rather be dead.
Kill me now, or the boss kills me later. Dead either way.
I will miss you, friend.
Rather be dead than go back to the dark.
You... rrggghh... rrrrRRAAAGGHHH!
You're not my friend anymore, Leo Redmane.
Sleep with your eyes open, wild woman.
Oh, Mutewind. I will BURY you for this.
You... are awful! Bash you so hard you need to be scraped up!
You don't scare me, little mask boy. I'll break you and all your little machines.
Bad! You're bad! Gonna bash you into RED MILK for this.
Hate the dark!
No, no, stop sending me to the dark!
So confusing, this Exile.
Bye bye!
Friend, no! NO!
Bwahahaha. Very messy.
I don't... understand... I was the boss...
You'll need more than brawn to best us, brute!
How did we lose to that bowl of rocks on a body?
Brains over brawn, every time.
You surprise me, Hillock.
I hope this one can tell us something!
Brute, wouldn't it be more fun to bash everyone?
You should have stayed dead, brute.
The brute clearly doesn't care.
A brute with backup is twice as fearsome.
Brute, you take on more than you can handle.
I serve a new God now, Exile.
Man the defenses! Bring me the Exile's head!
You dare desecrate these sacred grounds?
God tests our mettle! Protect the cargo!
Had you been a little earlier, you would have made a fine subject for these experiments.
God's judgement awaits you!
No prison can hold a true servant of God.
Ah, the bargainer! Let steel taste blood once more.
Perhaps we'll politick again, Exile, if you survive!
A true servant of God can never be defeated. Your efforts are futile.
I slew you, yet you return! I wonder how many times I'll get to kill you?
God's might is granted to a chosen few. Witness!
My legions are immortal.
I will crush you!
Charge into the fray!
I shall purify you in the flame of God's wrath!
You dare foul this sanctuary? To the death!
These grounds will not be defiled!
Do your work. Protect the cargo!
The work of the chosen must not be delayed.
God's judgement is swift and final.
Worry not Exile, your doom is certain!
Time for me to clean up yet another of your messes, Karui.
The crusade never ends, brother. Allow me to aid you.
Protect the noble bloodline!
Cameria, remember your lessons.
My new God appreciates your cruelty. I offer aid.
Time for me to clean up yet another of your messes.
This sanctuary will not fall as long as I remain standing.
Walls under the command of a fool are no more than sand shaped by a child.
If the Syndicate wanted this cargo stolen, they certainly chose their defender well.
The best way to take down multiple enemies is to strike when they are fighting each other!
This victory shall be mine.
I shall put you in your place, Karui.
Can you feel God's disappointment in you, heretic?
This world was made to be bent to Man's will. As were you, little girl!
You think death is your weapon alone, boy, but you are dearly mistaken.
I wish you had listened, Cameria.
You've had your chance. Now a real leader must step in.
Luckily I have the skill to destroy all comers!
This cargo will not be yours, traitor!
Careful, traitor, lest you end up a test subject at our next lab.
Just more souls to deliver to God!
I think not.
God becomes what we want him to be, and thus we can do no wrong in his name.
Mercy is not in me, assassin. Neither given, nor receivable.
I know full well the golden blood of your line of traitors!
Sentari was a fool. If I had been there, the Ezomytes would have been cut down to the last man.
Disappointing, but not unexpected. Let my final lesson begin!
Be quiet.
Now we cannot fail!
This cargo will not be yours, Exile!
You'll never succeed now, Exile.
You are doomed now, Exile!
And so you find yourself in your destined role, Karui: under my command!
God promised immortality, Elreon, but the Eternal One delivered. This is my crusade now.
You were born a weapon, Hillock, and I will wield you on behalf of the Syndicate.
It is good that you believe 'might makes right,' Thane. That means we agree I should be in charge here.
Bend your carving to the will of warfare, Aisling.
This is my crusade to lead now.
You will never achieve victory fighting only for yourself.
Secure the cargo, and make sure that one is fully dead.
Pile this carcass with the others.
You brought this on yourself.
God's plan continues apace. Until next time, Exile.
There shall be no prize for you this day.
A pity, Exile. You were so close.
Is no defense enough?
You brute!
You are no thing of God!
How is this possible?
The flesh can be bound and shackled, but faith will persevere in the end.
More deals, Exile?
Wait, wait!
I shall die a thousand times if needed!
Turnabout is fair play.
I don't have to win every battle to win the war.
Just a small misstep on the inevitable path to salvation.
You've made your show of force, savage. I submit, and entreat you to bargain in exchange for my life.

You are clearly superior. I admit defeat. Perhaps you would wrest from me a political reward? I'll bring on a fellow Syndicate member to this job at your behest. Perhaps someone weak, and easily exploitable.
I care not who I deceive in the pursuit of my goal. The Syndicate is full of Godless heretics seeking to evade eternal judgement.
Ah, I see your plans, Exile. You want to reorganize the Syndicate for your own reasons. Perhaps our goals align? I wish to stay alive for the moment, and you - what do you want?

I've been blind to the Syndicate's heresy for far too long. I am done with it. My only escape from the Eternal One is to remain alive. If you kill me, I'll just rise again, deeper in the Syndicate's clutches.
Strategic knowledge is the key to warfare. Spare me this time and I'll tell you what I know.
I prefer not to rely overmuch on the Eternal One's resurrection. Debts quickly become chains. Would you accept material reward in exchange for sparing me?
That serves my plans quite well.
One heathen is as good as another.
You are a wonderful pawn, Exile.
Solitary prayer shall guide me, in time.
Now you know what I wish you to know.
Drive the Syndicate into a corner and enrage it.
I always make sure to keep watch for an advantage over my superior officers. I know something that the Eternal One would very much like to hear about...
You could kill me here and now, or I could spread certain rumors that would undermine the positions of my fellows.

I don't see God after death, Exile. Not when the Eternal One brings me back. I'd prefer not to die if it can be avoided, and I have the political clout to lie to my superiors and get one of my fellows here excommunicated from the Syndicate. Care to make a deal?
I can't afford to die right now. I can offer knowledge in exchange. I will tell you everything I know about my fellows.
It is in my power to ruin another if you'll let me live, and I have no qualms over the fate of a Karui.
I have reason to doubt Elreon's faith, and I have long worked to gather leverage over him. Let me live, and I shall show you.
That pathetic excuse for a man is not worthy of the Perandus name. You and I must betray him before he turns on us.
That thing is no creation of God, Man, or Beast. Let me live, and we can both work against it.

You would do wise not to kill me. Cameria is just like me, but without refinement. He is a greater threat.	 God's plan does not include the weak or the corrupt. Let me live, and I can work against them.
Death holds no terror for me, Exile. It is you who should fear.
For the Syndicate, I give my life!
Stay strong, comrade. This Exile can inflict no worse than death.
No more prisons. You will have to slay me.
Traitorous scum!
I didn't think you had the nerve to risk my wrath - Haku.
It is always a turncoat who suffers the harshest of God's punishments. I do not envy the fate that awaits you.
Oh, Perandus, thy name is liar.
I should have expected this from an Ezomyte heretic.
We will talk about this later.
I will enjoy breaking you.
A true servant of God is no stranger to the Inquisition. I have nothing to hide.
I shall stand strong no matter how many times I face an Inquisition.
No deal this time? I underestimated your resolve, Exile.
Death is simply the way of this land. Get on with it, Exile.
Fool! Do not disrupt God's plan!
I cannot claim sorrow for that fool.
Bring your Inquisition, Exile. I guarantee I've personally run far worse than your darkest imagining.
Has failure taught you nothing, General?
Last chance, General...
On your knees, General.
A truce... for now.
I will enjoy watching you break, Gravicius.
The General is a renowned monster. This is no surprise.
Has death taught you nothing, General?
Good, yes, good. Turn against the General.
The little General needs aid, does he?
Exile, take out the General before he can rally these fools to order!
More meddling in my marvelous machinations?
Look at what limps into my lovely lair.
Filthy fleshy failures. Follow this.
Wanderer, what wonders you will witness...
Stop struggling and slip into silence...
I long for that cell. Such sweet silence. Silencing you will have to suffice.
Our past partnership was a debacle I dare not duplicate.
Past sins are past. Dance with me, darling.
Death was such a gift. Allow me to pay it forward.
An Exile, slain, returns, reaping regret repeatedly.
An Exile, slain, returns. Ugh, what a shame.
I am no brawler, but even I can browbeat the best of them with brawn like this!
The ground shall grow a garden of gristle.
No eloquence for this fight, exile. Just raw power!
Swiftly shall I sweep this skirmish for the Syndicate!
For the Syndicate, I shall sweep this skirmish swiftly!
Relics render one rather robust, wouldn't you say?
Impressive, interloper. But a fly does not flee the spider's snare so swiftly.
Hold your head high, friend. Help is here.
Don't dally. Duty calls!
Eradicate the explorers, then seal this sanctum.
Let's hasten this hatchet job!
Inspire me with your ichors.
Each cog must turn if the machine is to work.
Careful around my traps, Leo, lest you lose the other limb!
Only a Perandus could appreciate the complexity of my machinations.
Hillock! I'll hem them in, you bash 'em!
Show 'em what Ogham men can do, Jorgin!
Korell, we're even after this.
A bear trap requires at least two jaws.
Time to reorganize some of the gears in this diabolic machine.
Such inefficiency cannot go unaddressed.
The Syndicate seeks to shroud its secrets, even from us.
Do you never pause to question the machine?
Nothing against you, crusader, you're just in the way.
Tora! Time for another round!
Mind or might, Vagan? I wonder which will win.
I wonder what you could offer me to spare your life, Perandus.
How much can fury make up for skill, Redblade?
Despise the machinist, not the machine.
My defense plans already included your betrayal.
Really? Here? Now? You could have chosen your move so much better.
This is neither the time nor the place.
How can I get anything done with the constant infighting?
And I've learned never to trust a former Templar.
Wouldn't have it any other way, old friend.
It's a fine free-floating gear, this Syndicate. Round and round we go, getting nowhere.
We'll match wits, Rin, but don't be surprised at the outcome.
The mask isn't for my protection. It's for yours, Cameria.
If you want to kill me, you'll have to catch me.
The cogs turn, crushing exiles between their teeth.
Power shields itself rather wonderfully, wouldn't you say?
I doubt even our dear leader truly knows what happened here.
If the gears clash, apply more force.
Flair is what marks the difference between artistry and mere competence.
The Syndicate has your back, Vagan.
You simply cannot stay out of trouble, can you Janus?
Can you take orders, Hillock?
Do what you do Cameria. No orders needed.
It seems tactics and cunning are sorely needed here.
Off the gears you fall, Exile, whipping into darkness, drained of life by the vampire Time.
Your grand theft was automatically doomed to fail the moment you challenged me.
This house of splattered corpses masks the true terror of the Syndicate.
You should never challenge an immortal to combat. I will finish you every time.
The mechanism just keeps on grinding me toward the top.
You rode close on your carousel, Exile, but you never actually had a chance to touch this treasure.
The plentiful perversions of this place will never be exposed now.
Defender... down...
Do not... seek... the source...
Not in this place of filth!
I should have known better.
Back to the silence, I take it.
Wait... again, we can arrive at an accord...
I'll not become known as Riker the Betrayer.
Every time you kill me I just come back stronger.
A leap of progress, unpredicted...
It is possible to commit no mistakes and still lose.
It's not like me to make mistakes.
A savage slaying, if I say so. I seek to circumvent a similar sentence. Tell me what it is you desire.
The more tightly fit the cogs, the more efficient the machine. Choose the right cogs, and the machine may work in your favour. Choose the wrong ones, and... well... just don't choose the wrong ones.

There is much to be learned by watching the cogs turn. Even more with a little deconstruction. I have a certain cog in mind... allow me this, and in return, I will give you a glimpse of the machine's inner workings.
In this vast callous machine, one cog is indistinguishable from another. Switch two and soon you will see what I mean.
There is only one escape from the Syndicate, Exile: staying alive. Let me go, so that I may flee, and in so doing escape this unending machine whose only product is human misery.
Would you like to know how this cog fits into the grand machine, or do you plan on simply destroying it?
I wonder: what havoc could you wreak in these works with the right wrench?
The gears still rotate, but the pattern is new.
Just a glimpse, Exile... just a glimpse.
Watch as the production of misery and pain continues unabated.
To live free, to dream, only to return to the Syndicate upon death... goodbye for now, Exile.
And now you see that I am but one piece in a relentless uncaring machine.
Go, Exile. Wreak havoc.

There's an opportunity here. I could play this situation on my end to supplant my current overlord. That might alter - that might alter the Syndicate's workings in your favour. What are your thoughts?
Push others down, promote myself. It's the simple result of a complicated plan. Spare my life - I'm on the verge of implementing it.

Killing me now would not be ideal. I was just about to implement a plan to completely eject someone from the Syndicate machine and watch as it struggles to lurch onwards. Would you care to choose the victim in exchange for my survival?
I've made quite sure I know enough to save myself. Would you like large amounts of intelligence about each of my fellows? In exchange for my life, of course.
Vagan is a buffoon. A blowhard. A brat. A baboon who's never not in heat. He adds nothing of value to the Syndicate or this world. Get rid of him.
You're not truly going to punish me when Hillock could be brought to justice, are you?
The Redblade's destructive tendencies stretch far beyond the Syndicate's goals. We can contain him only as much as we can contain the fires he creates. Better to extinguish him now.
Cameria's bloody slaughter needs to stop, and no one else has offered to take the necessary action. Allow me to do something about him.
Aisling... no words can encapsulate the terrible things she is capable of. She is a truly terrifying sadist. You and I need to work together to put her down.
All part of the grand game. It's your move.
I'm afraid the only option here, for me, is execution.
The Syndicate must see that I am loyal enough to die for it.
I die in front of my fellows, only to rise again in service to the Syndicate.
I think I'll skip the interrogation and choose death instead.
An expected maneuver!
You forget that your Templar leaders wear masks, too, Elreon. Perhaps for the same reason?
I apologise that that's the impression you got, Guff. But for this, you understand, I must seek reprisal.
I'll get you back for this. Mark my words, Hillock.
I had no plans in mind for you, Rin. That will change.
Be careful where you step from now on, traitor. One trap is all it takes.
You will only garner from me that which I wish you to know.
This cycle of interrogation is as futile and fruitless as this foolish Syndicate.
Bargaining and interrogation are all the same, in the end.
I am well acquainted with death, but I must admit there is still a visceral terror associated with witnessing it.
I needed them. You've made a mistake.
Yes, Exile, you behaved exactly as I hoped.
This... was not in the plan...!
Do I know you? You wear a mask, but your eyes...
He planned for this. He expected our interference!
Leave the mask on. I don't care who he is.
Somehow, trusting this 'Riker Maloney' feels like a mistake... but I see no better option right now.
You may despise the machine, rogue, but you'll hate my prison even more.
Help us smash the machine you despise so much, rogue!
Humanity has left you, Riker. What is left to fight for?
You don't seem surprised, rogue.
All part of your machinations, rogue?
The rogue eyes a new step in his plan. Let us disappoint him!
So, you're the Exile. I hope you can take some heat.
Only a fool braves a Redblade's encampment!
Lay a hand on this cargo, Exile, and you'll pull it back blackened.
The Exile approaches. Burn the evidence!
Incinerating you will be as easy as snapping my fingers.
Let's be civil this time. No more imprisonment. Just death and politics.
There'll be no bargaining this time. Just you, silent... smoldering.
You'll not make me betray my fellows this time!
Don't you see? Death just makes me stronger.
I thought you were dead! No matter. This time, I'll cremate you!
The very ground burns at my touch!
Burn in the everlasting fires of the earth!
Let's see you get through my flames now, Exile.
Fire is not a Redblade's only skill. My sword seeks your blood.
The sight of you makes my blood boil! I shall make yours boil in kind.
This is no caldera-home, but you can believe I'll defend it like any Redblade warlord.
Allow me to lend my flame to this battle.
There will be no theft on my watch.
This will go quicker with fire.
Let's up the heat.
Start running now and you might just escape my flames.
Those that face the smoke end up finding the fire.
It seems your God has forsaken you, old man. Lucky for you, I have not.
Fight hard, Brinerot, or the Eternal One will hear of your weakness.
I admire you, Gravicius. Do not let me down.
Today we are allies, Mutewind. Do not waste this opportunity.
Solitude does not suit you, Laffrey.
Together, we will annihilate you Exile, and scatter your ashes to the wind.
You're an incompetent defender, and I am here to prove it.
I will not let you send our efforts up in smoke.
I'm here to clear this place out, present company included.
I will leave nothing here but scorched earth.
A simple burning is not sufficient for you, Brinerot. You will be incinerated.
Your fur will make wonderful kindling, bear-man.
Oh, Mutewind, you always knew this day would come.
Aisling, there are no words for the horrors I have witnessed at your hand.
Allies one day, enemies the next.
Burn in the fires of Redblade vengeance!
You're merely fanning my flames!
I'll leave you in my burning wake.
Flames don't care. You'll burn just the same.
More kindling for the fire.
Gladly.
Prayers? I don't need the Molten God's help to smite you.
The Syndicate makes past ties irrelevant. I understand.
Bring on your little tricks!
I'm going to burn you.
I'm here to add fuel to the fire.
This transport is too crucial to leave to anyone but a Redblade.
Burn this travesty immediately!
Let's burn this battlefield from both ends.
Vagan! Show me your fighting spirit!
My command over you was only ever a matter of time.
Put our typical relations aside, Thane, and do as I say.
If you so much as harm a hair on her head, Exile, the gods themselves will shudder at what I do to you!
Aisling, allow me to direct your deadly art.
Those who wish to live are wise to follow a Redblade warlord.
Like I said, only a fool braves a Redblade's encampment.
Keep moving, there might be others!
Keep cleaning! There may be others.
I will incinerate the carcass. No traces.
All who challenge a Redblade: fools.
Keep chasing. One day you might catch us, Exile.
You'll have to be quicker than that.
Perhaps... I... was the fool... today...
Some things... do not burn...
Up... in... smoke...
Extinguished...
Don't... cage this flame... again.
Felled... by the bargainer!
This is what I get... for betraying my fellows...
Extinguish me again... and I will still burn...
Our flames... ebb and flow, Exile.
This... was over before I even arrived. Foolish!
Hot-headed, I made an error.
You are brutal! My clan would have liked you, if they didn't want to throw you into the caldera. What would you have me do, murderer?

The Syndicate is built on trust, and trust cannot be broken by an outsider so easily. But if you were to choose someone on the inside, I could see my way into their circle of trust, and then... well, time will tell, won't it?
Let me act as your spy. Let me be the beacon that burns bright, sending signals from the distance. There is one in particular who casts an... interesting silhouette.

The structure of this organisation is as fickle as a flame. I see the patterns. I'm uniquely positioned to cause a shift in Syndicate roles. Let me live, and I'll put the right words in the right ears.

To have been caught in this manner... absolute humiliation. For this to happen, I must have angered the Molten One. I must make a sacrifice before I become one. Let me go. I'll return to my homeland and this - our conflict - will be done.

You don't want to kill me. You want intelligence about this job. Am I right? I think I am. There is no more potent a weapon against an organisation that hides in the shadows than the revealing light of knowledge.
I had a job to do here, and I failed it. Treasures are not given for failure, they are given for victory. And you will have them, if you will let me go.
Wise choice.
Let us see what the light reveals...
Consider it done.
The flames will serve as penance.
Good. Now listen closely.
Remember, even steel may melt...
Heat rises. Yet here I am, burning with passion, serving a leader whose failures are evident. But I need only light a fuse within the Syndicate to bring them tumbling down.

Ranks must be earned, and, by losing, my fellow soldiers here have failed to earn theirs. With the right move, you and I could have all these members demoted by the Syndicate. It could serve your plans.

You and I could cooperate to remove one of these members from the Syndicate altogether. It's only possible because of a precarious political... situation, so the offer won't last forever. What do you think? It's not too different than burning a man at the stake.
I am not above ratting on my fellows to stay alive... at least today.
Haku plays politics... poorly. For his own sake, I must betray him, lest he make greater enemies.
I'm no threat to you, but Leo needs a bit of knocking down.
Guff's a cheat and a thief, like any Brinerot. Let me live, so that I may be a thorn in his side.

Jorgin's a Thane from a distant island. We know what he did to his brother. A crime of the highest order. If he did it in my home, he'd have been fed to the mountain. I'd settle for something simpler here.
I do not want to do this, but I'll betray her for you if you let me continue my plans unhindered.
Not a Redblade, not my problem. Let's talk.
Like the phoenix, I will rise once more.
In front of my warlord, I'll die bravely.
Burn boldly, friends. Let us act as beacons.
No more prison. That's a coward's option. You'll have to slay me.
I will enjoy watching your skin blister beneath my hands.
Your bitingly cold Way will vanish under my Redblade flames.
'Can't never trust a Redblade,' but Guff, you're the one betraying.
You could have been so much more, Thane.
I expected no loyalty, but it still stings.
I always expected you to betray me, Riker.
I'll burn loyalty into you yet.
I won't tell you a single word!
You cannot... it's inhumane... inhumane!
You'd have been better off bargaining with me again.
Did you set out to become a monster, Exile, or was it an accident?
Bastard!
They'll be back, and stronger. I'll be ready.
The flames... they don't burn you... what manner of beast are you?
Where there's smoke, there's a Redblade. Get ready.
Don't try anything stupid, Korell.
Your fight's done, Redblade. Information. Now.
Not as dumb as you seem, Redblade.
We'll let you smolder behind bars for a while.
Redblade! Let your flames rage in every direction!
Burn them, Redblade. Set them aflame!
A Redblade sullies his pride by relying on numbers.
Go back to your volcano, Redblade!
There is no honour in this fight, Redblade. Turn back.
You are a blight on this beautiful continent. We are the cure.
That you've made it this far is an insult, muckblood.
Robbery, is it? Where I come from, we skin robbers alive.
It seems a rat has wandered into our hallowed halls.
The trap is sprung, little rat.
All that time in the darkness has only made me hate you more.
I can't believe I debased myself by cutting a deal with you.
My loyalties have been realigned, muckblood. Don't expect a repeat of when last we met.
I can still feel the cold creep of death when I close my eyes. Don't worry, you'll feel it soon enough.
Do you remember your defeat at my hand? You will.
Run, run, little rat. My arrows will still find you.
A riddle for you, Exile. How can one person be everywhere at once?
Embrace the snow, or be buried.
The blizzard answers my call!
With these boots I can shrug off the elements, even though the cold never bothered me anyway!
We are born leaders. You? You were born to serve us.
You've let them see too much. Slaughter them.
Imbecile! Don't neglect the cargo!
Feels as though the walls are closing in, doesn't it Exile?
We are everywhere.
Watch carefully, Exile. You won't see much else.
I'm honoured to serve such a noble cause.
Can your people do nothing right, Karui?
The sooner this is over, the sooner you can go back to the seas, pirate.
Don't make me regret this, disgusting demon.
Disgusting. Fight like a nobleman, Ezomyte.
Try not to get us killed, fire worshipper.
We fight for a pure future!
I'd sooner kill you myself than lose our claim here.
The others will be so sad to hear of your untimely demise...
You should never have crossed me.
I'm here to clean up your mess, yourself included.
Brinerot, I'll make you wish you went down with your ship.
First, you, then the rest of your filthy little clan, Thane.
Korell, it was only a matter of time. I'm just making the first move.
The Syndicate would be better off without you or your sadism.
You're devious, Maloney. Think you can keep up with me?
Muckbloods, the purification begins now.
You won't live to regret this.
You opportunistic little worm.
You'll never see daylight again, scum.
When this is through, you'll be naught but meat for the ants.
Oh, no, you won't see it coming.
Yuck. Your kind makes even the Brinerot seem appealing.
Don't you dare touch me, beast!
So that's how it is. I'm just 'Mutewind' again, like before.
Don't get caught in your own trap, beast.
Hah!
The wolves are circling you now...
It's over for you now, Exile.
Bow to your betters, trespasser.
We will tear you to shreds.
Try not to lose another limb, underling.
Bossing around a Brinerot? This feels right.
Your queen commands you to fight in her name, creature!
Cunning, not might, will win the day here. Follow my orders to the letter, Thane.
Serve me well, Korell, or I will be forced to extinguish you.
Do as I have instructed you, and victory is assured.
Good riddance.
Lowlife. Keep moving!
Just another body, now.
Good. What's next?
Worthless.
Success was inevitable.
You can't win.
How humiliating...!
All is lost.
Unfathomable!
Our chance... squandered...
No, no more prison!
Gods... not again!
I'm better than this!
I face death... again...
Thought it'd be as easy as last time...
Damn. Miscalculated.
I was blinded by fury...
Not even the Redblade are as... brutal as you. I will do as you ask, so long as you spare me.
Kill me and prove yourself to be the savage I know you are, or... surprise me. Set me free. I can bring someone into the fold on your behalf. Talk some respect into them. Please.

Is my life really worth sacrificing your chance to know more? That is what you would be doing were you to kill me, Exile. Instead, let me show you how useful I could be to you. I am quick to make friends, and even quicker to learn what it is I wish to learn. Allow me the chance to prove my talents to you, and all I learn is yours.
I'm ill-fit for this duty. You've proven that quite clearly. Is that a crime worthy of death? I think not. Rather, I ought to look for more suitable work, don't you think?
My Mutewind brothers and sisters warned me that leaving them would bring me nothing but darkness. Perhaps they were right. I think, if you'll allow me, I will take my leave of the Syndicate.

You are a bloodthirsty little beast, aren't you? I almost admire it. I think if I called your bluff I'd wind up dead, so instead, I offer you this: knowledge. Knowledge of all I have learned in my post here.
I could offer you pure Mutewind blood, or I could offer you material compensation. Take your pick.
Consider me surprised. I'll do as you asked.
I'll keep my end of the deal. Just remember this in the future.
You won't regret this!
When you meet the Lifegiver, give my regards... with a blade.
I knew you could be... reasonable.
A fair trade. Until next time!
Know why the Immortal Syndicate failed here? Because they didn't have Mutewind leadership. Instead they had some muckblood running the show. Well, how about we change that?
This is what I get for putting my trust in foreign might. Free me, and I'll show the others here how the Mutewind handle failures.

If you think I go into battle without a plan for every possible situation, well, you don't know me at all. My plan for this outcome? Shove the blame onto someone lesser-than. One of the nincompoops here will do, don't you think?
I'm not stupid. I know what you want. You want information. If you'll leave me living, I can tell you a great deal about my crewmates here.
Gods, how I've wanted a reason to stick it to that Brinerot scoundrel. Don't disappoint me, Exile.
Hillock's little more than a walking, talking avalanche. We Mutewind know how dangerous an avalanche can be. You should be wary, too.
Wait! I may be a Syndicate lackey for the moment, but Jorgin has committed fratricide. Would you really let a brother-killer just walk?
I cannot even begin to describe how much I'd enjoy watching that fire-worshipping, muckblooded Redblade lowlife squirm.
Look at Maloney's eyes. The cogs are turning. He's planning something. Do you want to wait to find out what, or shall we put him in his place?
I hate you, Exile, but only a little more than any of these other subservients. I'd harm any one of them to keep breath in my lungs.
Death is not the deterrent it once was.
In front of my captain, I'll die bravely.
Let me demonstrate the proper way to die.
Enough interrogation. You insult me. Death is the only choice I'll give you this time.
You think I didn't expect betrayal? I'm two steps ahead.
What did I ever do to you, Vagan?
You've lived down to your reputation, Brinerot.
Did... did you just betray me as a gift? You are the stupidest of stupid!
I do it simply to annoy you, Jorgin, because you can never return home.
I thought you said the Syndicate makes past ties irrelevant.
I already have plans in motion to account for this betrayal, believe me.
I'll only tell you what I want to tell you.
No matter how many times you interrogate me, I will never break.
I thought we had an understanding!
The price of failure.
You... you savage!
Silver linings!
I had it all planned out. How could I lose? I... I must have been sabotaged! But by who?
I spy a Mutewind! Careful, Exile.
Your blood didn't look that pure to me last time, Mutewind.
Pathetic. Stay, dog.
Don't make us regret this, Mutewind.
We'll get what we need from you one way or another, Rin.
Are you skilled enough to take us all on, Rin?
You fight for a lie, Mutewind. Go home.
Rin, you're too cunning to fall for the Syndicate's lies!
Clever, Rin, very clever.
If Rin is here, she sees some advantage we don't expect!
Don't do this, Exile. You can still join us. It's your chance to bring back anyone you've ever loved or cared about.
Stop... I can bring them back. I can bring Jun's entire order back! Just give me-
You found me at last... Very resourceful, Jun. I too am resourceful. Witness.
Give in, Jun!
See? We are no different, you and I. We've both slain your pathetic little order. Though, they put up more of a fight the second time around.
There's nothing that makes you feel so alive as death, is there...? Now, come to me Jun. Let us see what your soul is made of.
Hundreds of dead, rotting soulless in the earth. What a meaningless waste. But your souls... yours will serve.
You try and try and try to break us, and yet the Syndicate is immortal. Do you think this will end any differently?
Death will never come for an immortal.
Submit... Let our souls become entwined.
Your hopeless cause will destroy you!
I will imprison your soul forever!
Your faith was a veil for your base desires. Hypocrite, you are lucky your soul isn't going to your God.
Any system of belief, taken too far, can end in tragedy. Go to your brother now, Thane.
Can you hear them, Aisling? The souls of those you mutilated scream for your death. At last, their wish is granted.
Your ancestors are waiting for you Haku, but you will not see them. For this, I am sorry, old friend.
The legions of men you slew died for mere entertainment. But you, Leo, you shall die for a cause greater than you could have ever hoped.
How many did you send to an unexpected death, assassin? Look into my eyes... Goodbye, Vorici.
You believe yourself to be purer than the others. Better than them. But death... death is the great equaliser, Rin.
Such a long, faithful life you've lived. I'm sorry you will never get to see your God, Elreon.
We were not so different, Tora. We both killed for the good of Wraeclast. But now your hunt is over.
You are owed a warrior's death, but the needs of the cause outweigh your own, Vagan. I take no pleasure in this.
Guff, Your Brinerot took much of value from the people of Wraeclast. It is only fitting that you have something valuable taken from you.
Without you, Janus, the Syndicate would never have formed, and for that, I must thank you. But you will not be missed.
Have no fear, creature. Where you are going, the Lords have no hold over you.
Perhaps, Hillock, it was a mistake to bring you into the fold. One that can be fixed with ease.
How many did you fruitlessly feed to your molten god, Redblade? Yours is one soul that'll remain out of its reach.
You were a potent soldier, Cameria, but our cause was never your cause. For your service, I give you what you never gave your victims - a quick death.
I'd high hopes for you, Riker. Of everyone, I thought you would see what we could achieve... But you became caught in your own twisted machine.

The world is an ancient stone, rigid and immovable, and we are but water, rolling across its surface, leaving an ephemeral trail before we sink beneath its skin. So short are our lives that the stone seemingly remains unchanged.

Given enough time, the rain can shape a stone. Each drop's minute contribution, adding up over time, hews the stone's rough edges. But there is no grand design here. There is no individual guiding the stone into a useful form, only natural forces. Chaos.

But what if that weren't the case? What if there was someone guiding the rain? Someone able to plan far past the fleeting lives that limit us?

What new potential would we unlock?

What new thing have you learned today? Or this week? How far have you come in your lifetime? If you died today, how much of what you have learned would be lost for all time?

We advance as a society by building upon previous knowledge. Bricks stacked atop bricks. Too often are key advances lost due to an unforeseen death, leaving a gap in the wall. How long until someone climbs high enough once more to continue to build?

We cannot all live forever. Sacrifices must be made. But with sufficient time to build our knowledge, what we fuel with the blood of our brothers and sisters today may come freely tomorrow.

Each great movement has detractors - the powers that be naturally fight against any threat to their dominance. But steel is not forged in cool air, it is forged in vicious heat. 

The heat is coming, brothers and sisters. They will try to destroy us, pit us against each other, and put us in impossible situations, but, throughout, we must stand united. 

Though we crawl through the mud, acting in secrecy and silence, we are destined to become Wraeclast's saviours. Each sacrifice we must make is but a twig in the flames of our forge, and the day will come when our blade has been tempered into a mighty weapon and we may slice through the spectre of death once and for all.

We bury the dead. Insects feed on the flesh and bone... Rot takes hold... An entire lifetime reduced to feed for the grass above. A waste. But the soul, oh, the soul... The soul does not even feed the earth. It drifts invisibly into the ether, never harnessed, never used. Gone. 

What greater waste of life is there than to let the soul flutter away into nothingness? We hope and wish for something more, but here and now we have tools that will guarantee no afterlife be necessary. We have the tools to build a utopian life here, in Wraeclast, through thaumaturgy. The only thing we lacked was time, but the gift of the Horns has given us that too.

Brothers and sisters, there's a new empire in the making, and we are its founders. Those that die for our cause will live on within us, and their names will be etched into the foundations of our utopia.

People need a strong leader. As Oriath bubbles over and spills into Wraeclast, the ragged and the hungry will look to someone to keep them safe from harm. For now, it is merely a matter of survival, but it in time, a true society will form, and someone must step in to rule.

A city is not built in a day, nor even a lifetime. Sarn was being cobbled together up to the day it burned. With so many hands involved in its construction, fractures and slips were inevitable. People would fall through the cracks. Factions would form. 

Oriath didn't learn from Sarn's mistakes, but they cannot be blamed. The death of a ruler always has and always will throw an empire's direction into the wind.

With an Eternal Queen, this is a problem we will never have to face.
Arise, my children.
Darkness swarms!
Feed!
Feel death's grip!
Mortal!
Your soul burns for me!
Dead, give me life!
Give in, Jun!
Give your soul to me.
Kulemak!

An Exile...? Please, you must help me.

I-... I don't know where I am or how I got here. I don't remember my name... I don't-... I don't remember anything. I suppose for now you can call me... Cavas...
Remember me? When we're through here, you won't.
What secrets are you hiding in that murderous mind of yours? Let's find out.
Valdo had some ingenious designs hidden in his memories... observe!
Valdo's designs were flawed.
Do you remember dying here? You will.
What are you?
In this, the realm of the past, I am King, and you will bow!
This one is my own creation!
Plenty more where that came from.
Face your destruction!
No! Impossible! How!?
This isn't over. This will never be over! I will unify humanity!
Feel the pull of the void!
Yes, that's it! Death sweeps in.
I will crush you!
Sin surrounds you!
Faith empowers!
Belief overwhelms!
Bow!
Haha! Yes! Feed!
Obliterate sin!
Cleansing flames!
Repent!
Be no more.
Burn away sin!
Reveal your past!
Open your mind to me!
If I must destroy you before uniting mankind, I will.
You and I were allies once, even friends. A pity.
I owe you my renewed existence, but that debt only extends so far.
I cannot allow you to impede the cause.
With each new murder you make mankind more vulnerable!
Every friendship becomes a betrayal, given enough time.
Keep pushing me, and I'll be forced to pursue those close to you.
I will sacrifice everything for the cause. Can you say the same?
What morality do you have to stand in my way?
To think, I trusted you!
I wish I didn't know what I know now.
I will resist you to the last, because I must!
Begone!
I do this for all mankind.
Cower!
Repent!
Open your mind...
...and be erased!
I am everywhere.
Annihilate!
Wraeclast will serve...
And so will you!
Necessary!
Justified!
Obliteration!
Return!
Only a matter of time.
Be still!
Erasure!
Wraeclast needs me!
Light of salvation!
Darkness surrounds us!
I recognise these men! That's High Templar Venarius with his guards. The other man is Valdo Caeserius. A man of science. They are building something together. Something important.
That can't be right. Venarius was - is - a good man. A pious man. He would not lash out like that. No, he must have been provoked.
Valdo is shouting at him, you see? Threatening him. The High Templar has no choice!
Oh, dear! What just happened? Was that... because of me?

Apologies for the intrusion, Exile, but when we found my father's memory fragment, I thought we could explore it with Cavas' help... Now I know what a mistake that would have been. Cavas has altered this memory and he has likely been altering many others.
That's ridiculous. I'm innocent. All the memories we've seen clearly prove that.
Of course they do. You've made sure of that. You're no stranger to rewriting history... High Templar.
No.
Yes.
Was I... Am I...? I am the High Templar... Venarius? It's starting to make sense now. I sought power to wield against evil...
Stop! Can't you see what you're doing?
...And I found it. Yes, this is a start. This is more than I possibly could have hoped for when I drew the blade and awoke -- yes, of course! Now I can protect Wraeclast properly.
... protect Wraeclast...?
What am I, a monster? No, the real monsters surround us.
And what does that mean?

Demons, child. Countless. They watch us from the darkness. They claw at the thin veil that keeps our world separated from theirs. A great tide of evil that wishes only to crash down upon us and sweep our civilisation into oblivion. But I will stand against it.
Then we're on the same side. The entity that fed on your memories is doing the same thing to my father. Help us stop it!

Oh, little one, it is you who will help me... Your memories will show what I need them to show, for the cause. Every thinking man and woman of Wraeclast will come to simply know that they must unite... under me. It is the only way to guarantee a unified defence.
We won't let you get away!

All these memories we've collected... When I gaze upon them, I feel as though I'm close to remembering something important. Like there are memories trapped in my mind but I just can't quite reach them.

Oh. Oh dear. Oh DEAR! I've remembered something! Exile, it is time we go to the Nexus.

I remember this! This place is the Nexus of... uh... something. The name doesn't matter. What matters is what it can do! A doorway! A doorway into these memories!

Here. Take them and lay them out in this machine. It will reinforce the stability of the memories. They won't last too long, mind you, but they'll remain long enough to be explored. Build a path to the memories that lay out of reach. I'm sure this will help us. Sure of it!

Yes, that was wonderful Exile. For a brief moment I felt whole again. Here, let me try something...

Hello Exile, my name is-...

Oh. Oh dear. I thought, maybe... But no.

Well perhaps we can try again. Though the machine seems to keep the memories more stable, they still degrade. Keep that in mind - because I'm not so sure I will be able to.

I don't know who I am, but I do know that this... thing here is important. That there are answers inside.

You look strong... Could you spare a moment to help an old man? Perhaps we can solve this mystery together.
How strange... I can see through your eyes. This place seems so familiar, yet... There! That strange object is important, I'm sure of it!
Oh dear! It seems your time here is limited. Make haste! I feel the world around us dissolving!

I... I think this was a memory of mine. It has been corrupted, but I indeed recall fragments... A sunny day at the beach when I was but a boy. I remember the warm sand between my toes. I chose a seashell to bring home... A happy day. 

But... I do not remember taking the shell home. I do not remember home at all. So much is yet missing... Wait! I remember seeing another of these memories. Where was it? Oh dear. I don't remember... 

I'll take this with me. I might remember if I take it with me. I hope we run into each other again soon.

I thought for a moment I knew that place... I cannot be sure, and now it is gone. Oh dear... Wait...! I think I remember seeing another one of these memories somewhere... Where was it? Oh dear. I don't remember. 

I must have a look around. It was around here somewhere... Or was it back in that cave? Was I in a cave? Hmm.
It's alright, Exile. I'm sure that memory was nothing I truly needed... after all, how many memories does a man really need to be considered himself again? We'll keep looking.

An Exile...? Please, you must help me -

Oh, it's you, my friend. I can't seem to hold on to my thoughts for long... 

Can you spare another minute to help me? Enter this memory... let us experience it together so that we might ascertain its owner.

Even shattered as I am, I know that memories floating around like this is not... normal. I believe something terrible has happened to me. 

What if other men fall victim? What if mothers forget their children? What if... what if the children are left alone and scared to fend for themselves in a world of nightmare... Exile, can you fathom the horror?

I remember nothing at all, save the flash of the sun on my mortal skin in a dream. I was a living man. I know I was. Ask me again when we have retrieved further memories, and I shall hopefully have more to tell you.

I was... a good man! I fought for God. I remember saying so. That symbol... the Descry... it stirs my half-remembered blood to think of it. I wanted to do good things. Important things. Can you imagine finding the truth of oneself on the wrong side of morality? I have thought long on this fearful notion... but now I know, exile, and that relieves me. I am no longer afraid to recover more of my memories.

I'm certain now that I was a Templar. Yes, I remember watching their mighty parades through Oriath Square as a child, and I can still feel that sense of satisfaction the day I truly donned the mantle. All of the pain and sacrifice was worth it, to do good, to protect mankind... to protect the children...

I was a Templar, yes, but now I remember that I secretly despised them. I understood that they were a diseased organization prone to brutal oppression. Friend, was I exiled as well? I cannot imagine my resentment would have gone over well with my superiors. Maybe I kept my thoughts to myself and lived a life of quiet desperation, but I feel like I was the kind of man to act.

So what did I do?

Exile, there is something about all this that I cannot fathom. The memories I somewhat understand. A man's thoughts, a woman's remembrance, a child's sorrow - these things come from the living, or the once-living. They are real. But the ancient bridges that you cross between memories? Those were already out there. They came from no man, woman, or child of our land.

I suspect those pathways are not made of the iron we think we see. To dwell on their origins or true nature could send one over the brink, I suspect!

These are memories, yes, but they are also real in a sense. We feel pain within them. We find real material objects within them. Yet some of these objects are not quite right. It is as though they are stuck, half-remembered. 

There's a device in the Nexus that seems attuned to such objects. It seems to draw upon their properties to create something new. Its creator must have been seeking something very important in his or her past... I wonder if they ever found it.
It is time, friend. Energy courses through my being. I sense an opportunity to weave together my memories. Let us abscond to the Nexus!
An Exile...? Please, you must help me... do... something...
An Exile...? Please, you must help me... do... something... I can't remember...
Oh, hello there! I was meant to do something, but I can't for the life of me remember what... Let's try this again later.

I sense within myself a natural affinity for the curious. I am not overly curious myself, but rather, I appreciate the rare resource that is a scientific soul. The child's work is crucial to protect mankind from the nightmare that lurks... out there. Her work must continue no matter the cost.
That man is quite ...jolly, but he doesn't seem to be able to see me yet. Perhaps that will change when I regain my memories.
Sometimes I think she senses my presence, but she is too surrounded by ghosts of her own to take heed of me.
The revenant looks right at my eyes when I try to talk to her. She listens, but has nothing to say to me. What does that mean, Exile?
The treasure hunter has her eye on one thing and one thing only. If she senses my presence, she gives it no notice, for I do not gleam of gold.

The miner is the only one, other than you, who can hear me in my current form. We converse at length, and his conversations help me keep my wits about me in this time of loneliness, but at times he seems to speak to others that not even I can perceive. There is too much competition for his attention.
Please! Kind soul!
Oh, lost again...
Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear...
Sapinti went on her first fishing trip alone and did not return. When her body finally washed ashore, it looked as though it had been mummified for a thousand years. The fish did not touch her flesh.

She was perfectly preserved, but drained of her blood. We buried her, but within days the earth rejected her. Whatever killed her took root in that place. The earth soured and we had to move, abandoning her body.
This memory seems ancient. I do not believe this was mine, and I hope I never learn more of it.
Why won't you let me leave? I found you so many yellow rocks... this pick is getting dull, and I'm so tired...
I can't... get up... stop hurting me...

Oh dear. I don't know whose memory this was, but they were far too young for such cruelty. Sometimes, Exile, mankind makes me weep. Who could create such an inhuman system of exploitation, and for what purpose?

I used to pride myself on taking care of these tomes, but the ancient treatises concerning the Vaal... should be burned. He's making me research for him, and the things I am reading about concern the destruction of all mankind.
I would think my fears of the end of the world ridiculous... except... it's happened before. I must run... I must flee... and take my secrets with me.
Exile, was this me? I'm no master of the spoken or written word, so I don't think I was a scholar.

I awake to the sound of screaming. My eyes and throat sting. Smoke billows into the hut from outside. Something is terribly wrong. I dash outside and am confronted by a wall of heat. Smoke makes it difficult to see, but the village is in flames.

I run from the smoke and, to my horror, realise we are trapped. A rival tribe stands at the only exit, cutting my brothers and sisters down as they flee. We've been ambushed. I run towards the flames and leap, praying to Valako for protection.
Oh dear, such violence and hate... I wonder why the tribes were at war. It's clear this is not something I ever experienced, at least.

I see you. You are here seeking answers, because you can find them only in the stories we will leave behind when Malachai and Voll cause our destruction. In this final hour, I entertain the notion that the words I write exist in some form beyond me. Do they go on as dreams? As memories?

I have the wildest notion that perhaps you will find a way to pick up scraps of memory, and you, whoever you are, will come across this one someday. If you do, I ask only this: slay Malachai. Slay him for yourself, or slay him for all the lost citizens of the Empire, but, most of all, slay him for Marylene.

Oh, Exile, though I am a mere shade with only figments of memory, I can say with certainty that no man has ever felt the nuances of rage and love so strongly. His was the strongest memory I have ever felt, an imprint of his entire essence. His name... was Victario.
You and I, we're the only ones that made it to shore... alive, anyway. This place is crawling with criminals. Find something you can defend yourself with.
That'll do for now. I thought I saw some smoke rising just north of here. Could be worth checking if there's--
I saw you through someone else's eyes, Exile! That was a memory from someone that knew you! He was relieved to see you. Were you close?
I take no pleasure in this. It simply must be done. Humanity's purpose has been fulfilled... in me. Within this sanctum of flesh lay the tools I shall use to reshape the world.
With this act, I sweep away the trappings of mortality, and bring about a new age. A world of Thaumaturgy, and I, its ruler. Farewell, my Gemling Queen...
Who was that, Exile? I felt such drive and focus. Nothing mattered but my one goal. It was... terrifying.
It's him! He sails back to me, my Daresso! I shall sing for him. I shall show him the way.
It's my Daresso! He sails back to me! I shall sing for him, and show him the way.
The last vestiges of human thought in a woman consumed by madness... she saw her beloved in every passing ship, and sang to them all, never realizing their true fates.

I've seen men and women turn mad, but I've never seen a case like Niko... I think the ores and compounds he's been handling have been affecting his mind. He seems to be aware of it, too.

Can it really be called madness when it is of your own doing?

It's a shame. I'm sure we will encounter many subterranean environments where his expertise would be invaluable, but I simply can't risk our safety. The Atlas presents its own potential threats to sanity... putting additional pressure on Niko might send him right over the brink.

When I was a young girl I used to play with the neighbourhood stray cat, and one day it started bringing me mice. Einhar is that stray cat. Has he been trying to feed you raw meat too? I just don't have the heart to tell him how inedible it is. 

The first time he handed me a big raw steak, I began to cook it over the fire, and he told me I was 'ruining all the good red.' Since then, I've just hidden it when he isn't looking. Sometimes I open up a map and hurl it in there. I know how irresponsible it is, but... Einhar's a sweetheart. I don't need to see under the mask to know how deeply he feels emotions, and I can't bear to hurt him. 

Watch your step out there. You may land on some of my rotten scraps.

As a fellow explorer, I must admit admiration for Alva. Her motivations may not be as philanthropic as mine, but you can't deny that her methods get results. Do I wonder what kind of repercussions all her time travel is having on us? Of course! But we don't really know what the consequences of our travel through the Atlas are either, and I'm not interested in throwing stones while living in my own little glass house. 

I do wish she'd look past profits, but we've all benefited from her finds in one way or another.

Navali's powers are impressive, yes, but they are not without their limits. It seems her knowledge of things to come is restricted to our realm, however broad that may be. When it comes to the Atlas, her predictions don't seem as reliable. 

I wonder how much of this is due to the source of her powers... she claims to have been given the gift of second sight by the Karui goddess Hinekora, but since the gods returned I've heard nothing of Hinekora. Is Navali being misled by a deceptive entity? Or is Hinekora keeping a low profile? Perhaps the goddess simply has no interest in us, as she has her own flock to tend.

Regardless, it may be worth remembering that although Navali is a good friend to have, she has her own agenda like anyone else; an agenda she may have been given by her benefactor.

I've tried getting to know Jun, and maybe I'm reading into things a little bit here, but I don't think she likes me. Whenever I try to talk to her, she gets quiet and averts her eyes. I've seen her fight, so I don't think she's exactly shy... and I catch her staring at me every so often. Long stares. The kind you do when you're lost in thought. 

I wonder what I did to offend her...

No matter! I'll just stay the course. I'm sure with a little more alone time we'll become fast friends.

I wish I could say I trust Helena, but I've seen one too many of Dominus's blackguards suddenly snap. The training and indoctrination they go through does not leave much room for one's own judgement. 

I'm not trying to sound ungracious. She's done a lot for us, but I'd be telling a fib if I claimed I didn't sleep with a blade beneath my pillow when she's around.

What a strange entity you found, Exile. Completely devoid of memory, yet cognisant, and even driven... I hope to find the time to really get to know him, but I've been so caught up with the happenings out in the Atlas.

Perhaps I'll join you on one of your memory ventures soon.

Apologies for the intrusion, Exile, but when we found my father's memory fragment, I thought we could explore it with Cavas' help... Now I know what a mistake that would have been. Cavas has altered this memory and he has likely been altering many others.
Of course they do... you've made sure of that. You're no stranger to rewriting history... High Templar.
Oh, yes.
Stop! Can't you see what you're doing?
... Protect Wraeclast?
And what does that mean?
Then we are on the same side. The entity that fed on your memories is doing the same thing to my father. Help us stop it!

I can't... I don't...

Exile, did you know? No, of course not. I don't think Venarius even knew who he was, how could you? But he knows now, and it seems he may remember many other things as well. 

If Venarius is capable of rewriting memories, he could plant very dangerous ideas into the minds of the vulnerable. We need to find those memories before he does. Don't worry, you're not alone in this. We are a team.
Fantastic work, Exile. Here, take one of these. It will help us continue to pursue that entity.
